title: Why inflation is losing its punch — and why things could get even better
description: Annual inflation fell to 3% in June, the lowest since March 2021. That probably won't stop the Federal Reserve from raising rates again, but this month's expected hike could be the last.

title: Biomedical startups are racing to revolutionize the way humans reproduce
description: Companies are racing to accelerate and commercialize in-vitro gametogenesis, or IVG, which would make human eggs and sperm in the lab from any cell in the body containing anyone's DNA.

title: A devastating attack claims 6 lives in Mexico's Jalisco state
description: Mexican authorities say an organized crime group targeted police with at least seven improvised explosive devices. The governor called it an act of terror, and the military is now investigating.

title: Egypt is suffering neither war nor chaos, but people are migrating away anyway
description: Egyptians were among the hundreds of migrants on a ship that sank off of Greece last month. The deadly voyage cast a spotlight on the number of Egyptians risking it all for a chance at a better life.

title: FBI Director Chris Wray defends agency at House Judiciary Committee hearing
description: The FBI director faced heated questions from Republicans on the House Judiciary Committee, who assailed the bureau for that they said are politically-motivated investigations.

title: Fuel prices have tripled in Nigeria, squeezing millions who are already struggling
description: In Nigeria, fuel costs have tripled over the last month and are expected to rise even further, a major hit to millions of people who are struggling to get by already.

title: Looming actors strike reflects major tensions in Hollywood
description: SAG-AFTRA, the union representing some of Hollywood's biggest stars, is set to go on strike Thursday. Barring a last-minute breakthrough in talks, it could be the latest strike to shake up Hollywood.

title: NATO pledges its support for Ukraine, but gives it no timeline for membership
description: President Biden said NATO countries will help Ukraine defend itself against Russia now and into the future, even as they did not offer a clear pathway for Ukraine to join the alliance.

title: Plastic is suffocating coral reefs — and it's not just bottles and bags
description: A new study takes a comprehensive look at the plastic debris smothering reefs, where in the ocean it's more prevalent — and how to deal with the problem.

title: The 2023 Emmy Awards: Breaking down this year's nominees
description: Nominations for the 75th Emmy Awards were announced Wednesday in Los Angeles. Succession, Ted Lasso and Beef racked up nods in multiple categories.

title: UPS workers could be on course for a historic strike within weeks
description: Workers at UPS could be heading for a strike. If that happens, it would be the largest walkout against a single company in U.S. history.

title: Meta's Threads wants to become a "friendly" place by downgrading news and politics
description: Mark Zuckerberg has pitched Meta's Twitter clone as a more "friendly" place for online discourse. Executives say breaking news and politics will not be the emphasized. But is that realistic?

title: 'Missing' Houston man Rudy Farias says his mother brainwashed him
description: Farias was discovered alive in Houston last month. Details that have emerged since then indicate that Farias had in fact returned home and was living with his mother.

title: Fox News hit with another defamation lawsuit — this one over Jan. 6 allegations
description: Trump supporter and Jan. 6 protester Ray Epps sued the network over the allegations of former star, Tucker Carlson. Carlson repeatedly placed Epps at the center of the siege on the U.S. Capitol.

title: Our 'Scorched Planet' is getting hotter, and no one is immune to rising temperatures
description: New York Times journalist Jeff Goodell warns a new climate regime is coming: "We don't really know what we're heading into and how chaotic this can get." His new book is The Heat Will Kill You First.

title: Ukraine can't join NATO yet. But Biden says Zelenskyy is OK with that
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy left the NATO summit satisfied with offers of long-term security aid from the United States and other G-7 countries, according to President Biden.

title: 3 people dead and at least 14 are injured after a Greyhound bus crashes in Illinois
description: The bus was traveling west on Interstate 70 when it crashed into commercial vehicles parked on an exit ramp, the Illinois State Police said.

title: A former Manson Family member is free, after her parole was reversed 5 times
description: Leslie Van Houten was denied parole more than 20 times — including five reversals from California's governor's office — over the brutal murders of Rosemary and Leno LaBianca in 1969.

title: FBI Director Wray grilled as House GOP members allege 'politicization' of the agency
description: Wray faced a wide range of questions by House Judiciary Committee members, most framed as accusations that the FBI pursues a political agenda targeting conservatives.

title: So your tween wants a smartphone? Read this first
description: When's the right time to start your child with a phone? Is 12 too young? Here's what a professional screen time consultant tells parents about the risks kids face online.

title: Heat waves in Europe killed more than 61,600 people last summer, a study estimates
description: Researchers estimate that 61,672 Europeans died from heat-related illness between late May and early September 2022. They're urging countries to step up their heat prevention and adaptation efforts.

title: In 'The Vegan,' a refreshing hedge-fund protagonist
description: Andrew Lipstein achieves the difficult feat of realistically animating a hedge fund manager who talks and moves as real hedge fund managers might, but who is compelling and not overly alienating.

title: As climate change looms, New York bets big on winter sports tourism
description: Officials in New York are on track to spend $1 billion taxpayer dollars refurbishing 40-year-old Winter Olympic sports and tourism sites near Lake Placid. Critics doubt it will pay off.

title: Microsoft says Chinese hackers breached email, including U.S. government agencies
description: The U.S. government and Microsoft reveal Chinese hackers broke in to online email systems and stole some unclassified data.

title: NEA announces 2024 Jazz Masters including Terence Blanchard and Gary Bartz
description: The National Endowment for the Arts has selected Terence Blanchard, Willard Jenkins, Amina Claudine Myers and Gary Bartz for the prestigious honor.

title: Why can't we stop homelessness? 4 reasons why there's no end in sight
description: Many cities have devoted considerable focus and money to house people, only to see the number living outside continue to rise.

title: Inflation eases to its lowest in over two years, but it's still running a bit high
description: Consumer inflation hit 3% in June, the lowest since March 2021. Though easing prices will be comforting to the Federal Reserve, inflation is still running higher than the central bank would like.

title: Up First briefing: Zelenskyy at NATO; SAG-AFTRA deadline; #whitepeoplefood
description: Biden will meet with Zelenskyy today at NATO. The contract between Hollywood studios and the actors' union is set to expire. American-style lunches are going viral on Chinese social media.

title: Milan Kundera, who wrote 'The Unbearable Lightness of Being,' dies at 94
description: The Czech writer tackled big topics — sex, surveillance, death, totalitarianism — but always with a sense of humor. Blacklisted and banned in the Soviet Union, he left for France in 1975.

title: It's back-to-school shopping time, and everyone wants a bargain
description: Spending on back-to-school supplies is predicted to decline this year, for the first time since 2014. With inflation top of mind, parents and teachers are looking for ways to save money.

title: Doug Burgum is offering $20 to people donating $1 to his campaign. Is that legal?
description: "Depending on the outcome, it will either be viewed as genius or the dumbest political move in history," political science professor Patricia Crouse told NPR.

title: Doug Burgum is offering $20 to people donating $1 to his campaign. Is that legal?
description: "Depending on the outcome, it will either be viewed as genius or the dumbest political move in history," political science professor Patricia Crouse told NPR.

title: 8 mistakes to avoid if you're going out in the heat
description: You can still enjoy the outdoors this summer despite the scorching weather, if you're smart about it. Here's what to watch out for and how to stay safe.

title: After a review, 'Barbie' movie will show in the Philippines, after all
description: The country's film regulator has decided that a map shown in the movie does not depict China's controversial nine-dash line.

title: How a UPS strike could disrupt deliveries and roil the package delivery business
description: A strike by UPS workers would likely mean package delays for consumers across the country and it would shake up an increasingly competitive industry.

title: Republicans want answers from FBI Director Wray in their push for Biden probes
description: Wray will field questions from GOP Chairman Jim Jordan and other Judiciary Republicans who accuse the agency of "weaponizing" its power for political reasons.

title: Mikala Jones, Hawaii surfer known for filming inside waves, dies in surfing accident
description: Mikala Jones, a Hawaii surfer known for shooting awe-inspiring photos and videos from the inside of massive, curling waves, has died after a surfing accident in Indonesia. He was 44.

title: Elizabeth Holmes may be released 2 years earlier than originally sentenced
description: Disgraced Theranos CEO Elizabeth Holmes' sentence hasn't changed, but like all prisoners who follow the rules, she can qualify for early release under the federal government's "good time" guidelines.

title: Iowa Republicans pass bill banning most abortions after about 6 weeks
description: Iowa's Republican-led Legislature passed a bill banning most abortions after roughly six weeks of pregnancy during a marathon session Tuesday. Gov. Kim Reynolds said she would sign the bill on Friday.

title: A jury rules a handwritten will found under Aretha Franklin's couch cushion is valid
description: Multiple handwritten wills were found in Franklin's home in 2019. Two of Franklin's sons would like a 2014 will to be honored and are up against their brother, who wanted to uphold a 2010 will.
